other_tests.findings: Visual acuity was 20/30 in the right eye and 20/100 pinholing to 20/25 in the left eye.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Visual acuity decreased from 20/30 to 10/200 in the right eye abruptly over 2 months, then remained stable at 20/400 in January 2003.

other_tests.findings: Central scotoma in the right eye.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased atrophy and subretinal fibrosis under the fovea from January to June 2001.

other_tests.findings: Showed hyperpigmented and hypopigmented areas, no bone spicule pigmentation. In February 2001, small subfoveal hemorrhage was present, but no definite CNV lesion was identified.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased atrophy and scarring consistent with involuted CNV lesion noted from January to June 2001.

other_tests.findings: Patient was heterozygous for a substitution mutation in the CHM gene.
Subretinal changes consistent with fibrosis and cystoid edema in the right eye.
